candidates.news_summary: Merck & Co., Inc. (MRK) has recently demonstrated significant advancements in its oncology portfolio, highlighted by a successful five-year study of intismeran autogene in combination with KEYTRUDA, which showed a 49% reduction in recurrence risk for high-risk melanoma patients. The company is also expanding its collaborations, notably with Guardant Health to develop companion diagnostics for new cancer therapies. Analyst upgrades and a strong performance in the oncology sector position MRK favorably, with a recent price target increase to $135. Overall, MRK's stock reflects a solid return trajectory, with a 15.3% increase over the past year.

Additionally, the company has maintained a strong dividend history, with an annual payout of $5.69 per share, making it an attractive option for income-focused investors. Notably, Costco has switched back to Coca-Cola products for its food courts, ending a decade-long partnership with PepsiCo, which may impact brand visibility and sales.
